DESCRiPTiON

To show how the cameras have taken over from traditional policing, Caught on
Camera has access to 20 different police forces and CCTV control rooms across
Britain. Wallis goes out with the police onto the city streets and finds out
how the CCTV operators and police combine their skills to catch criminals,
hooligans, and drunks around the clock.

Victims of crime, have-a-go heroes and detectives also explain how the cameras
have helped to resolve their own particular cases. This episode focuses on two
of the most common areas of crime caught on camera drunkenness and violence.
In Huntingdon, CCTV recently recorded alcohol-related violence each weekend as
the sleepy town turned into something resembling the Wild West.

In Rotherham, CCTV operators Martyn and Dave are in radio contact with
nightclub bouncers in order to help prevent trouble

Enjoy!
